description: This course serves as the 300-level requirement for the Nordic Studies Major. Its intent is to prepare students for advanced academic and professional work in the field of Nordic Studies. It engages critically with the question of what makes the Nordic countries distinctive, moving beyond common stereotypes to explore the complex historical, social, and political dynamics that have shaped the region. Offered alternate years in the spring semester. Prerequisite: Declared Nordic Studies Major and Junior or Senior.
name: Pro-Seminar in Nordic Studies
prerequisites: Declared Nordic Studies Major and Junior or Senior.
